programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are giving an elephant an endoscopy to check on the progress of her cancer treatment, and Paul helps an elephant arriving in AandE with chronic diarrhoea.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Dr Katy has been given custody of two endangered Hawksbill turtles in Karratha - we follow their journey back to the sea; Ed and Dunc collect squid for their sustainable eating display in Ocean Park.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Discover how some of the worlds most extraordinary animals are also the smallest. This action-packed episode will take you deep into rainforests, under the oceans and across vast deserts.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Theres some extreme vetting for Julian as he tries to help a struggling ewe give birth in an open field in the rain, and Peter performs an emergency C-section on heavily pregnant shih tzu Madge.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian faces a massive challenge trying to save one of the biggest calves that hes ever had to deliver, and Peter operates to remove a cancerous testicle from owner Margarets dog.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: The team of vets are giving an elephant an endoscopy to check on the progress of her cancer treatment, and Paul helps an elephant arriving in AandE with chronic diarrhoea.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Some species have baffled scientists. We discover the biological marvel that is the saiga antelope, the odd diets of the gelada baboons and greater bamboo lemurs and much more.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian faces a massive challenge trying to save one of the biggest calves that hes ever had to deliver, and Peter operates to remove a cancerous testicle from owner Margarets dog.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its birthing season on Jackie Barlows alpaca farm, and Peter heads over to West Yorkshire to open a brand-new animal hospital run by his friends and colleagues.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter rushes into Skeldale on his day off to try to save a lamb of Richard Bells, and Julians treating a very poorly one-week old llama called Noah at Suzanne Bensons trekking centre.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Real Jungle Book
programme.desc: In India, we follow the daily struggles of the living characters Rudyard Kipling described in The Jungle Book as all obey the unwritten law of the jungle and strive to raise a new generation.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: Our planet has had a difficult and violent past; the potential for life all began when Earth collided with another protoplanet the size of Mars shortly after the formation of our solar system.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: Fateful Planet
programme.sub-title: Throughout its history, Earth has continuously fluctuated between greenhouse and icehouse; however, this particular icehouse phase is the most extreme period of cold our planet has ever witnessed.
programme.desc: Our planet is marked by catastrophes whether collisions in the solar system, asteroid strikes, volcanic eruptions or global climatic crises; this series reconstructs some of these historic catastrophes.

programme.title: The Worlds Most Beautiful Landscapes
programme.sub-title: Discover the Mekong river in southeast Asia, following its course through six countries via astonishing waterfalls, the worlds most amazing lake, and one of the worlds most diverse rainforests.
programme.desc: Travel through the worlds most beautiful landscapes; from wide views to the tiniest close-up, witness spectacular footage and discover the glories of rivers, jungles, and mountains from every angle.

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: The language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most striking and diverse behaviours of the animal world: dances, challenges, fights, pulses, and battles to mate with females.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy travels to one of the few rivers left on Earth that will still test a fisherman; one spirit in particular is said to lure fishermen from their boats to their death.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Leopards live in a thousand ecosystems from the rainy jungles of India to the driest regions of Africa; they adapt to almost any climate, feeding on over 100 different species.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: The Real Jungle Book
programme.desc: In India, we follow the daily struggles of the living characters Rudyard Kipling described in The Jungle Book as all obey the unwritten law of the jungle and strive to raise a new generation.

programme.title: Yellowstone Super Volcano
programme.sub-title: Hidden beneath Yellowstone National Park lies a super volcano; scientists use cutting-edge tech to explore what they believe could be the largest natural disaster thats waiting to occur.
programme.desc: Hidden seven miles below Yellowstone National Park lies a super volcano; a super eruption would kill millions and would be the biggest threat to life on Earth, but how likely is it to happen?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Leopards live in a thousand ecosystems from the rainy jungles of India to the driest regions of Africa; they adapt to almost any climate, feeding on over 100 different species.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We discover how some animals communicate when they need to work as a team; using a variety of techniques including sound, touch and visual displays, animals can come together and work as a group.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Being thin, having black spots on whitish hair, hyperventilating and licking regularly to evaporate saliva are the cheetahs most efficient tricks for tolerating its fiery environment.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Most species that live in extreme places are delaying their life cycles of reproduction and breeding; wild dogs are advancing their biology by several weeks to avoid the dangers of heat to their pups.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Wild Fighters

programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Katy treats a Staffie with a deadly disease, a Great Dane rescues a dog needing a blood transfusion, and Rick and zoologist Ed Swinhoe test a wild dingos DNA in the outback near Exmouth.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: For natures giants, being the biggest brings huge advantages and challenges. From massive land mammals to ocean behemoths, how natures giants overcome lifes big problems is awe inspiring.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its birthing season on Jackie Barlows alpaca farm, and Peter heads over to West Yorkshire to open a brand-new animal hospital run by his friends and colleagues.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Peter rushes into Skeldale on his day off to try to save a lamb of Richard Bells, and Julians treating a very poorly one-week old llama called Noah at Suzanne Bensons trekking centre.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: An elephant is brought into AandE with a suspected deadly herpes virus, Kat treats the infected foot of a female elephant, and we visit the largest herd in the hospital swimming in the river.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Katy treats a Staffie with a deadly disease, a Great Dane rescues a dog needing a blood transfusion, and Rick and zoologist Ed Swinhoe test a wild dingos DNA in the outback near Exmouth.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Discover how some of the worlds most extraordinary animals are also the smallest. This action-packed episode will take you deep into rainforests, under the oceans and across vast deserts.
programme.desc: We explore the extraordinary lives of natures wildest, most incredible, and sometimes weirdest animals and discover how they have learned to adapt, survive and evolve in every corner of the Earth.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Julz and Henry from the ZCP track the Kakumbi pups as they face off with a warthog, and Thandie Mweetwa - ZCPs lion specialist - counts the prides that are pushing the Manzi out of their territory.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian heads to the historic Harewood House near Leeds to check on some goats who are moving to a new enclosure, and Peter heads over to help when a young farmer struggles with a tricky lambing.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.sub-title: Julian is at Jackies alpaca farm to see one of his favourite alpacas, and Peters at Arthur Almonds farm because three of his cows need dehorning... but they arent used to being handled.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its Sunday morning, but its no day of rest for Julian as he heads to the Taylors farm; at Skeldale, shih-tzu puppy Lester - who needs surgery on a hernia - has all the staff purring.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian faces a massive challenge trying to save one of the biggest calves that hes ever had to deliver, and Peter operates to remove a cancerous testicle from owner Margarets dog.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Being thin, having black spots on whitish hair, hyperventilating and licking regularly to evaporate saliva are the cheetahs most efficient tricks for tolerating its fiery environment.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Hot Life: Africa
programme.sub-title: Most species that live in extreme places are delaying their life cycles of reproduction and breeding; wild dogs are advancing their biology by several weeks to avoid the dangers of heat to their pups.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: The language of love and the fight for reproduction stimulate the most striking and diverse behaviours of the animal world: dances, challenges, fights, pulses, and battles to mate with females.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: Wild Fighters
programme.sub-title: Territory is home, the place where animals rest, find food or have their children. Many animals are very territorial: they defend their clan against strangers as their survival depends on it.
programme.desc: Animals fight to ensure their survival, but what are the reasons that make them risk their lives every day, and what are the consequences of winning or losing these battles?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: People on two bottomless lakes deep in the Alaskan wilderness have been vanishing without trace for thousands of years; Jeremy searches for a lethal lake monster of native legend.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.sub-title: Being thin, having black spots on whitish hair, hyperventilating and licking regularly to evaporate saliva are the cheetahs most efficient tricks for tolerating its fiery environment.
programme.desc: The threat of climate change is above all a risk for those who live in hot regions of the world like Africa; will its incredible living beings be able to resist a little longer?

programme.title: Wild Talk
programme.sub-title: We discover how some animals communicate when they need to work as a team; using a variety of techniques including sound, touch and visual displays, animals can come together and work as a group.
programme.desc: Recent years have seen an explosion of research into zoosemiotics (the science of animal communications); experts are listening to animals on their own terms to decode their secret languages.

programme.title: Yellowstone Super Volcano
programme.sub-title: Hidden beneath Yellowstone National Park lies a super volcano; could understanding the behaviour of the planet during other natural disasters help us understand the power of a super volcano?
programme.desc: Hidden seven miles below Yellowstone National Park lies a super volcano; a super eruption would kill millions and would be the biggest threat to life on Earth, but how likely is it to happen?

programme.title: Lost Beasts: Unearthed
programme.sub-title: Investigators in the Badlands of Wyoming unearth the bones of a Mosasaur, a terrifying marine predator from the dinosaur age.
programme.desc: From deadly T. rexes to giant woolly mammoths, new evidence reveals how giant beasts evolved to conquer the planet, how they grew so big, and what triggered their extinction.

programme.title: Giants
programme.sub-title: Dan ONeill is on a mission to find, film and measure the planets biggest predatory sharks; he heads to the Neptune Islands, a place that is perfect for spotting giant great whites.
programme.desc: Explorer, biologist and conservationist Dan ONeill is on the trail of the largest living animals in the world; what does it take to become and survive as a giant past or present?

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: If we had to pick one iconic African animal, it would be the elephant. Its ancestors have dominated the world and the five continents through an exceptional evolution.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: Animal Odyssey
programme.sub-title: Today, the grizzly bear is a star in Yellowstone National Park. But the history of the bear is rooted in that of a large family of mammals: the carnivores, which appeared 60 million years ago.
programme.desc: Where, when, and how did the species we know appear? Today, science has unravelled the great journeys of the species, allowing us to tell the amazing story of animal colonisation.

programme.title: The Elephant Hospital
programme.sub-title: A young bull elephant is rescued after breaking his leg in a violent thunderstorm, and laser technology is used to save an elephant who has come into AandE with severe burns.
programme.desc: Take a trip to the worlds largest hospital devoted solely to treating elephants: the Elephant Hospital in Lampang in Thailand, which cares for over 100 sick, injured or neglected elephants each year.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr James sees an emergency case involving two pets, Dr Kiara has concerns about a lump on blue-tongue skink Edward, and Dr Kelly performs tiny surgery on two very small German ram fish.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wildest Survival
programme.sub-title: Living your life at night can present extreme challenges and opportunities. Animals like owls, hyenas with super senses and insects that glow have evolved to succeed in this world without light.
